26468981.trustfund:
TF092849-ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF094862-Korea Trust Fund to Cofinance
            the Road Asset Management Project
26468981.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Road Asset Management
            Project for Cambodia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: monitoring and evaluation (M and
            E) frameworks that are useful beyond the project level need
            to employ indicators that are relevant to decision-makers.
            Use of temporary, parallel systems does little to create
            lasting and durable improvements and or change. Strong
            commitment of the implementing agency is key to success. The
            combination of supervision by local Bank staff whose
            proximity enables them to provide timely advice and solve
            problems, with the participation of international staff with
            expertise in specific areas when needed, yields good
            results. Capacity and system gains can be leveraged to meet
            broader needs.

repnme.cdata!: Cambodia - Road Asset Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Road Asset
            Management Project for Cambodia is to ensure continued
            effective use of the rehabilitated national and provincial
            road network in support of the economic development in
            Cambodia. It will do so by improving the institutional and
            technical capacity of the ministry of public works and
            transport for road maintenance planning, budgeting and
            operations, and by expanding and strengthening maintenance
            activities. The changes include: (i) a nine month extension
            of the credit closing date from September 30, 2013 to June
            30, 2014 to complete the ongoing project activities; (ii) a
            re-allocation of the project proceeds based on the
            disbursement forecasts; and (iii) an adjustment of
            International Development Association (IDA) road maintenance
            target. The project is now in a good dynamic to achieve its
            development goals. The Project Development Objective (PDO)
            and the overall implementation performance have been rated
            moderately satisfactory and satisfactory.
